items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. River levels are high but steady. Further rainfall is possible later this week and may keep river levels high and above the alert threshold. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 12 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. Light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at Torksey Gauge are falling, but still pose a flood risk at high tides. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses & plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. No further rainfall is forecast until Friday, 12/12/2025. River levels at Pillings Lock gauge are falling but forecast rainfall could cause a further rise in levels. Levels will remain high until the weekend. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The forecast is for a predominantly dry night, a band of rain will pass over on Friday which may be heavy at times. Levels are currently high but stable. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

We expect levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, especially in the Woodstock area along the River Glyme.  The forecast is for a predominantly dry night, a band of rain will pass over on Friday which may be heavy at times. Levels are starting to fall slowly along the Evenlode and Glyme, but will remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.description: River Thames for the Abingdon area
items.message:
"High river levels this morning may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads along the River Thames is expected in the Abingdon area. The forecast is for a predominantly dry night, a band of rain will pass over on Friday which may be heavy at times. River levels are now stabilising but expected to remain high and possibly out of banks over the next 24-48 hours.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue,  between Thame and Dorchester on Thames.  

The forecast is for a predominantly dry night, a band of rain will pass over on Friday which may be heavy at times. 

River levels are not expected to rise further along most of the River Thame and have stabilised along much of its length. The river near Dorchester on Thames will rise slightly overnight because the River Thames is still rising in this area. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: The river level on the Wriggle, the river Cam , the River Yeo at Pen Mill have fallen. Levels remain high at Sherborne Lake remain high following rainfall on Tuesday but are falling slowly. There is the chance of further showers, heavy at times, overnight from Thursday into Friday 12/12/25. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is likely in this area, including around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 11 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message: River levels remain high but are beginning to fall, so therefore the risk of flooding remains today 11 December.  Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. We are closely monitoring the situation . Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . This message will be updated by 11:00 on 12 December or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bracknell Forest, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message:
High river levels this morning may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the morning of 11 Dec 2025

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible today, especially in the Free Prae Road area on the Chertsey Bourne. This is in response to recent rainfall. No further significant rain is forecast for today or tomorrow. Therefore, we expect river levels to continue to fall over today, 11 Dec 2025. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 9pm on 12 Dec 2025, or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Oaksey area however it is no longer expected. The forecast is for a predominantly dry night, a band of rain will pass over on Friday which may be heavy at times. River levels are falling slowly. We expect levels to continue to fall overnight.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

River levels remain high at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after recent rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. Some rainfall is expected Friday morning that may keep levels up. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 12 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding is possible today, 11 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible today, Thursday 11 December 2025 and over the next few days.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.

River levels will remain high over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.


This message will be updated by 10:00 on Friday 12 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following rainfall on Tuesday. As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. There is the chance of further showers, heavy at times, overnight from Thursday into Friday 12/12/25. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 8.39m and is falling. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.40m and is stable. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. River levels are now steadily falling and we expect this alert will be removed in the next 48 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 12 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.

Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 11 December 2025. 

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding may continue over the next few days. 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. 

Predicted peaks:- 

Mythe 3.8m to 4.2m on Saturday 13/11. 

Haw Bridge 4.6m to 5.0m on Saturday 13/11. 

No flooding is expected at other gauge locations currently. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .

River levels are expected to remain high over the coming days.

items.message:
Stour levels continue to rise at Wimborne and Throop gauging stations. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Lower Dorset Stour tributaries between Wimborne and Christchurch. Further flooding may be possible as river levels are rising due to previous rainfall. Minor rainfall Friday morning may keep levels high. We closely monitoring the situation. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
River levels remain high on the River Derwent. As a result, flooding is possible today, Thursday 11th December 2025 and overnight into Friday 12th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be local roads and low-lying land near rivers around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Friday 12th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

River levels continue to rise at the Ross on Wye river gauge and remain high at Belmont, Old Wye Bridge and Mordiford river gauges. Flooding continues on 11 December 2025 . Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Peaks:- Hay on Wye peaked at 3.63m on 09/12 Bredwardine peaked at 5.72m at 7am on 10/12 AM, Belmont peaked at 5.35m on 10/12 PM, Old Wye Bridge peaked at 4.66m on 10/12 PM, Mordiford peaked at 4.86m on 10/12 eve. Predicted peak: Ross on Wye 4.2m to 4.3m on 11/12 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

The River Tone at Currymoor Pumping Station is still high. There is the chance of further showers, heavy at times overnight from Thursday into Friday 12/12/25. This flood alert will remain out as rivers are still high. The current River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is 7.41m and is steady. Water enters Currymoor via Hookbridge spillway if this level exceeds 7.45m. The current drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 5.31m and rising slowly. Cutts Road floods if this level is above 5.75m, and New Road floods if it is above 6.18m. We are continue to monitor rainfall levels and pumping has begun this morning. Further pumps will be turned on as soon as the river has capacity to take further water. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and continue to rise. Flooding continues. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye. .Predicted peak: Ross on Wye 4.2m to 4.3m on 11/12 PM, Lydbrook 5.0 to 5.3m on 11/12 eve.. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Levels remain high today, 11th December 2025. Levels will remain high today and into later this week. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. Townfield Lane is now impassable. We currently not expecting to issue Flood Warnings at this time.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.  
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 11 December 2025. 

Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. 

Predicted peaks:- 

Bewdley 3.6m to 4.0m Friday, 12/12/25. 

Worcester 4.4m to 4.7m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Diglis 4.0m to 4.4m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Kempsey Yacht Club 6.0m to 6.5m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Saxons Lode 4.4m to 4.9m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Kempsey Yacht Club 6.0m to 6.5m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.

Locations most affected will be Low-lying land, including agricultural land and local roads in the areas around Masham, Boroughbridge, Aldborough and Bishop Monkton.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 08:00AM, Friday 12th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Due to recent rainfall, river levels remain high but steady. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. River levels at Willington Gauge and Shardlow Gauge will continue to remain high over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 12 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
River Ouse levels in York have peaked but remain high.  As a result, flooding is possible today, Thursday 11th December 2025 and overnight into Friday 12th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land in York and to the south as far as Naburn Lock, including Kings Staith, Queens Staith, and South Esplanade. River levels are beginning to fall slowly. We are closely monitoring the situation and are operating the Foss Barrier. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. 

This message will be updated by 8:00 AM on Friday 12th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 11 December 2025 and may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the river from Shrewsbury to Upper Arley. Locations that may be affected are White Abbey, Coalbrookdale, Ironbridge and Bridgnorth. River Severn bankfull at White Abbey, floodplain may be filling at Hayes Basin. Peaks:- Montford 5.63m overnight Wednesday 10/12, Welsh Bridge 3.2m to 3.4m 11/12 PM, Buildwas 4.3m to 4.5m 12/12 AM, Bridgnorth 3.6m to 3.8m 12/12 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding today.  Flooding is expected from the early hours of 11 December 2025.  Flooding may affect Gabb Lane at Apperley and local caravan parks. Predicted peak at Haw Bridge 4.6m to 5.0m on 13/12.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high due to recent rainfall and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 11 December 2025. items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area
Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Some further rainfall is expected Friday and across the weekend which may see levels react further.  Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.  We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels falling but the level of Windermere remains high following recent heavy rainfall. Heavy rainfall over the last few days keeps the river level high at the Briantspuddle gauge station. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. Some rainfall Friday morning may keep levels high. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels checking rivers for blockages. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ouse at York - riverside properties
items.message:
River levels in York have peaked but remain high today, Thursday 11th December 2025, and are forecasted to slowly begin falling.

Locations most affected will include properties on King’s Staith and riverside areas from Lendal Bridge to Millennium Bridge.

The Foss Barrier is operating, and flood gates in York have been closed. We expect levels to begin falling slowly later on Thursday and into Friday.  

We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 12:00am on Friday 12th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Clanfield Brook for Clanfield Village and the Shill Brook for Bampton
items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Clanfield area, however it is no longer expected. The forecast is for a predominantly dry night, a band of rain will pass over on Friday which may be heavy at times. River levels are now falling and are expected to continue falling overnight. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message: River levels remain high from previous heavy rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Lower Dorset Frome, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around areas in East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham . River levels are continuing to fall. There is some rainfall expected Friday morning that may keep river levels high. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 12th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Levels on the Holderness Drain remain high. As a result, flooding is possible today, Thursday 11th December 2025 and overnight into Friday 12th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers in the Holderness Drain area, including Leven and Bransholme. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels, operating pumping stations and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.                                                                                                                     
 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Friday 12th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 11 December 2025 as a lot of rain fell in the past week. 

Flooding is affecting low lying land, roads, cycle tracks and footpaths close to the river. At Langbridge and Alverstone, river levels are continuing to fall. At Sandown river levels are stable. There is flooding of Golf Links Road and Moreton Common Road. Ditches around Fort Holiday Park will struggle to drain while river levels are high. River levels and flood risk should reduce tomorrow but the river will be responsive to further rainfall over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will ensure the river is kept free of reported blockages. 

Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible Thursday 11 December 2025.

River levels in the lower reaches of the system are still slowly rising in response to the rainfall earlier in the week. Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible.

Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas on the Deben from Debenham to Ufford, including Framsden, Earl Soham, Easton, Glevering and Wickham Market, and on the Rivers Lark and Finn around Witnesham, Tuddenham St Martin, Playford and Grundisburgh.

We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10am Friday 12 September, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
River levels remain high. As a result, flooding is possible today, Thursday 11th December 2025 and overnight into Friday 12th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Friday 11th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. However, this warning is likely to be reissued on the weekend of 13th and 14th December 2025 as heavy rain is forecast. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Levels remain high on the River Derwent at Buttercrambe. Levels have peaked further upstream, our forecasts indicate that levels in Buttercrambe will begin to slowly fall later today, Thursday 11th December. However, levels are likely to remain high into the weekend.

Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 

Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals .  

This message will be updated by 12:00AM on Friday 12th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, River Cary

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. There is the chance of further showers, heavy at times, overnight from Thursday into Friday 12/12/25. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads near the River Yeo, River Parrett and River Cary, particularly around the Ilchester to Yeovilton road at the end of the runway. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . We are clearing blockages from debris screens, bridges and culverts. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message: River levels remain high in the Pen Mill and Ilchester and the lowland areas around Long Load and Huish Episcopi. There is the chance of further showers, heavy at times, overnight from Thursday into Friday 12/12/25. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Yeo, River Parrett , with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester. The Ilchester to Limington road and road to Ilchester Meads. There is also a risk of flooding at Hainbury Mill, Ilchester. Water reaches bottom of ringbanks at Ilchester Meads and Ilchester. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will pump when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Act on your flood plan if you haven't already. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. River and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. The remainder of Wednesday and Thursday will be mainly dry. There is the chance of further showers, heavy at times, overnight from Thursday into Friday 12/12/25. This flood alert will remain in force whilst levels remain high. Flooding will affect areas near the Rivers Yeo, Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain and Sowy, with low lying land and roads most affected, including Westover Trading Estate at Langport. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 1.00PM on 12 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
